CONJUGATES: noun: rust | rusts; verb: rust | rusts | rusting | rusted
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English rust, from Proto-Germanic *rustaz, related to Old Norse ryð, Old Frisian rest, Old High German rost. Ultimately cognate with red.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun (a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A reddish-brown or yellowish-red flaky coating of iron oxide formed on iron or steel by oxidation, especially in the presence of moisture.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 铁或钢在潮湿空气中氧化后形成的一种红褐色或黄红色的、易剥落的氧化铁涂层。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The old car was covered in rust.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: verb (a word that describes an action, state, or occurrence)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of iron or steel) to become covered with rust.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The iron gate began to rust after a few years.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb (a verb that takes one or more objects)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To cause iron or steel to become covered with rust.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 潮湿会使金属迅速生锈。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun (a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A state of deterioration or decline due to inactivity or disuse.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 因长期不活动或荒废而导致的衰退或退步。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His old skills had suffered from rust after years out of the game.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 多年不玩后，他的老技能生疏了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: verb (a word that describes an action, state, or occurrence)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To deteriorate or become less effective through disuse or neglect.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 因长期不用或疏忽而衰退；荒废。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: If you don't practice, your skills will rust.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 如果你不练习，你的技能就会荒废。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun (a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Any of several destructive fungal diseases of plants, characterized by reddish-brown spots or streaks on the leaves and stems.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种植物真菌病害，特征是叶子和茎上出现红褐色斑点或条纹。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The wheat crop was affected by rust this year.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 今年的小麦作物受到了锈病的影响。
